item.title: Coding and Visualizing the Expectation-Maximization Algorithm
item.description: Two demonstrations are provided in this post. The first demonstration uses Python and R code to reproduce a coin-flipping example in a popular publication on the expectation-maximization (EM) algorithm. The second demonstration uses Python and R code to reproduce a population depiction of the EM algorithm whereby a likelihood function is approximated and optimized by a lower-bounding function.
